intro: Glandularia aurantiaca var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth glandular rattlebox, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its glandular leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is known for its hairy stems and capsule fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native range.
